Etymology. THE INfLaTEd LasT wHOrL frOm dOrsaL vIEw, EspECIaLLy THE R2 Is rEmINIsCENT Of a bIsON’s HUmp ( Bison sp., BOvIdaE ). THE spECIEs NamE
bison Is UsEd
as a NOUN .

Diagnosis. A mEdIUm sIzEd spECIEs wITH TypICaL
Dicharax
- TypE rIbs ON THE INfLaTEd R2, vEry sHOrT R2 aNd R3, rOUNdEd pErIsTOmE aNd aN ELEvaTEd fUNNEL-sHapE sTrUCTUrE ON THE OUTEr sIdE Of THE OpErCULUm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. SHELL ( FIGUrE 21A ) yELLOwIsH Or sLIGHTLy GrEENIsH IvOry; sHELL OUTLINE rOUNdEd Or sLIGHTLy OvaL frOm dOrsaL vIEw, spIrE raTHEr fLaT, wITH CONspICUOUsLy INfLaTEd R2, EdGE Of bOdy wHOrL rOUNdEd; prOTOCONCH LOw, CONsIsTING Of 1.5 wHOrLs (N = 2), raTHEr maTTE; R1 CONsIsTs Of 1.75–2 wHOrLs, rEGULarLy, dENsELy rIbbEd, rIbs LOw, wITHOUT spIraL LINEs; rIbs bECOmING sLIGHTLy mOrE wIdELy-spaCEd TOwards ENd Of R1; TraNsITION bETwEEN R1 aNd R2 CLEarLy vIsIbLE; R2 vEry dENsELy rIbbEd ( FIGUrEs 22A–B ), rIbs CUrvEd TOwards THE apErTUrE; CrOss sECTIONaL vIEw Of R2 ( FIGUrEs 22C–D ) COULd bE ExamINEd IN ONE spECImEN: aNTErIOr CrUsT fOrms a sIGNIfICaNTLy ELEvaTEd, HOLLOw rIb THaT Has a sTrONGEr aNTErIOr aNd wEakEr pOsTErIOr prOjECTION; THE aNTErIOr CrUsT fOLds OvEr THE mUCH wEakEr pOsTErIOr CrUsT THaT Is aLsO HOLLOw; CrOss sECTIONaL vIEw Of mICrOTUNNEL drOp-sHapEd; COmbINEd LENGTH Of R2 aNd R3 sHOrT, apprOxImaTELy 70–80 dEGrEEs ONLy; R2 aNd R3 Of abOUT THE samE LENGTH; TraNsITION bETwEEN R2 aNd R3 CLEarLy vIsIbLE, INdICaTEd by a dEEp CONsTrICTION; R3 wITH swELLING vEry CLOsE TO pErIsTOmE; R3 IrrEGULarLy wrINkLEd, raTHEr smOOTH aNd GLOssy; apErTUrE aLmOsT pErfECTLy rOUNd; bOUNdary bETwEEN TwO LIps HardLy vIsIbLE, OUTEr LIp sTrNGLy ExpaNdEd, sHarp, ONLy sLIGHTLy ExpaNdEd; INNEr LIp vEry wEak.

Operculum. THE OUTEr sUrfaCE ( FIGUrEs 23A–C ) Of THE OpErCULUm Is COrNEOUs, mULTIspIraL, bUT NO LamELLa Is vIsIbLE. IN addITION TO THIs sUrfaCE, THErE Is aN ELEvaTEd, dEEp fUNNEL-LIkE sTrUCTUrE HavING rECOGNIsabLE COILs, sTarTING frOm THE EdGE Of THE NUCLEUs. THE EdGE Of THIs "fUNNEL" Is sLIGHTLy bENT IN THE dIrECTION Of THE OpErCULUm. THIs fUNNEL-LIkE sTrUCTUrE Is prObabLy HOmOLOGOUs wITH THE mULTIspIraL LamELLa ON THE OUTEr sUrfaCE Of THE OpErCULUm Of OTHEr aLyCaEId spECIEs. THE INNEr sIdE ( FIGUrEs 23D–F ) Of THE OpErCULUm Has aN ELEvaTEd, CENTraL NIppLE.

aNd sOmE pOpULaTIONs LIsTEd UNdEr

Distribution.
